entry.title: Messe brève no. 7 (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the Messe brève no. 7 by Charles Gounod (pictured) is an 1890 Missa brevis that he derived from an earlier work for only two voices and organ?

entry.title: Technoblade (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that deceased YouTuber Technoblade beat the video game Minecraft in hardcore mode using a racing-wheel controller?

entry.title: paleoflora of the Messel Formation (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the paleoflora of the Messel Formation has had monographs documenting leaves, flowers, fruits, seeds and even pollen?

entry.title: David P. Davies (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that David P. Davies was the chief test pilot for the United Kingdom's Civil Aviation Authority for 33 years?

entry.title: stabbed her mother to death (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that in June 2009, a teenage girl and her adult boyfriend stabbed her mother to death when she objected to their relationship?

entry.title: National Agrarian Union (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the National Agrarian Union opposed the introduction of female suffrage in Sweden?

entry.title: Mary Mara (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Mary Mara felt the writers of Nash Bridges "started to write for me really well about halfway through the season"?

entry.title: pontifical (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that a pontiff in pontificals may pontificate with a pontifical at a Pontifical during his pontificate?
